intro: Eutacta subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf eutacta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. Eutacta subulata is native to South America, particularly Chile and Argentina, and thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
